00026 /*
00027  * Java Debug Wire Protocol Transport Service Provider Interface.
00028  */
00029 
00030 #ifndef JDWPTRANSPORT_H
00031 #define JDWPTRANSPORT_H
00032 
00033 #include "jni.h"
00034 
00035 enum {
00036     JDWPTRANSPORT_VERSION_1_0 = 0x00010000
00037 };
00038 
00039 #ifdef __cplusplus
00040 extern "C" {
00041 #endif
00042 
00043 struct jdwpTransportNativeInterface_;
00044 
00045 struct _jdwpTransportEnv;
00046 
00047 #ifdef __cplusplus
00048 typedef _jdwpTransportEnv jdwpTransportEnv;
00049 #else
00050 typedef const struct jdwpTransportNativeInterface_ *jdwpTransportEnv;

00052 
00053 /*
00054  * Errors. Universal errors with JVMTI/JVMDI equivalents keep the
00055  * values the same.
00056  */
00057 typedef enum {
00058     JDWPTRANSPORT_ERROR_NONE = 0,
00059     JDWPTRANSPORT_ERROR_ILLEGAL_ARGUMENT = 103,
00060     JDWPTRANSPORT_ERROR_OUT_OF_MEMORY = 110,
00061     JDWPTRANSPORT_ERROR_INTERNAL = 113,
00062     JDWPTRANSPORT_ERROR_ILLEGAL_STATE = 201,
00063     JDWPTRANSPORT_ERROR_IO_ERROR = 202,
00064     JDWPTRANSPORT_ERROR_TIMEOUT = 203,
00065     JDWPTRANSPORT_ERROR_MSG_NOT_AVAILABLE = 204
00066 } jdwpTransportError;
00067 
00068 
00069 /*
00070  * Structure to define capabilities
00071  */
00072 typedef struct {
00073     unsigned int can_timeout_attach     :1;
00074     unsigned int can_timeout_accept     :1;
00075     unsigned int can_timeout_handshake  :1;
00076     unsigned int reserved3              :1;
00077     unsigned int reserved4              :1;
00078     unsigned int reserved5              :1;
00079     unsigned int reserved6              :1;
00080     unsigned int reserved7              :1;
00081     unsigned int reserved8              :1;
00082     unsigned int reserved9              :1;
00083     unsigned int reserved10             :1;
00084     unsigned int reserved11             :1;
00085     unsigned int reserved12             :1;
00086     unsigned int reserved13             :1;
00087     unsigned int reserved14             :1;
00088     unsigned int reserved15             :1;
00089 } JDWPTransportCapabilities;
00090 
00091 
00092 /*
00093  * Structures to define packet layout.
00094  *
00095  * See: http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.5/docs/guide/jpda/jdwp-spec.html
00096  */
00097 
00098 enum {
00099     /*
00100      * If additional flags are added that apply to jdwpCmdPacket,
00101      * then debugLoop.c: reader() will need to be updated to
00102      * accept more than JDWPTRANSPORT_FLAGS_NONE.
00103      */
00104     JDWPTRANSPORT_FLAGS_NONE     = 0x0,
00105     JDWPTRANSPORT_FLAGS_REPLY    = 0x80
00106 };
00107 
00108 typedef struct {
00109     jint len;
00110     jint id;
00111     jbyte flags;
00112     jbyte cmdSet;
00113     jbyte cmd;
00114     jbyte *data;
00115 } jdwpCmdPacket;
00116 
00117 typedef struct {
00118     jint len;
00119     jint id;
00120     jbyte flags;
00121     jshort errorCode;
00122     jbyte *data;
00123 } jdwpReplyPacket;
00124 
00125 typedef struct {
00126     union {
00127         jdwpCmdPacket cmd;
00128         jdwpReplyPacket reply;
00129     } type;
00130 } jdwpPacket;
00131 
00132 /*
00133  * JDWP functions called by the transport.
00134  */
00135 typedef struct jdwpTransportCallback {
00136     void *(*alloc)(jint numBytes);   /* Call this for all allocations */
00137     void (*free)(void *buffer);      /* Call this for all deallocations */
00138 } jdwpTransportCallback;
00139 
00140 typedef jint (JNICALL *jdwpTransport_OnLoad_t)(JavaVM *jvm,
00141                                                jdwpTransportCallback *callback,
00142                                                jint version,
00143                                                jdwpTransportEnv** env);

00147 /* Function Interface */
00148 
00149 struct jdwpTransportNativeInterface_ {
00150     /*  1 :  RESERVED */
00151     void *reserved1;
00152 
00153     /*  2 : Get Capabilities */
00154     jdwpTransportError (JNICALL *GetCapabilities)(jdwpTransportEnv* env,
00155          JDWPTransportCapabilities *capabilities_ptr);
00156 
00157     /*  3 : Attach */
00158     jdwpTransportError (JNICALL *Attach)(jdwpTransportEnv* env,
00159         const char* address,
00160         jlong attach_timeout,
00161         jlong handshake_timeout);
00162 
00163     /*  4: StartListening */
00164     jdwpTransportError (JNICALL *StartListening)(jdwpTransportEnv* env,
00165         const char* address,
00166         char** actual_address);
00167 
00168     /*  5: StopListening */
00169     jdwpTransportError (JNICALL *StopListening)(jdwpTransportEnv* env);
00170 
00171     /*  6: Accept */
00172     jdwpTransportError (JNICALL *Accept)(jdwpTransportEnv* env,
00173         jlong accept_timeout,
00174         jlong handshake_timeout);
00175 
00176     /*  7: IsOpen */
00177     jboolean (JNICALL *IsOpen)(jdwpTransportEnv* env);
00178 
00179     /*  8: Close */
00180     jdwpTransportError (JNICALL *Close)(jdwpTransportEnv* env);
00181 
00182     /*  9: ReadPacket */
00183     jdwpTransportError (JNICALL *ReadPacket)(jdwpTransportEnv* env,
00184         jdwpPacket *pkt);
00185 
00186     /*  10: Write Packet */
00187     jdwpTransportError (JNICALL *WritePacket)(jdwpTransportEnv* env,
00188         const jdwpPacket* pkt);
00189 
00190     /*  11:  GetLastError */
00191     jdwpTransportError (JNICALL *GetLastError)(jdwpTransportEnv* env,
00192         char** error);
00193 
00194 };
00195 
00196 
00197 /*
00198  * Use inlined functions so that C++ code can use syntax such as
00199  *      env->Attach("mymachine:5000", 10*1000, 0);
00200  *
00201  * rather than using C's :-
00202  *
00203  *      (*env)->Attach(env, "mymachine:5000", 10*1000, 0);
00204  */
00205 struct _jdwpTransportEnv {
00206     const struct jdwpTransportNativeInterface_ *functions;
00207 #ifdef __cplusplus
00208 
00209     jdwpTransportError GetCapabilities(JDWPTransportCapabilities *capabilities_ptr) {
00210         return functions->GetCapabilities(this, capabilities_ptr);
00211     }
00212 
00213     jdwpTransportError Attach(const char* address, jlong attach_timeout,
00214                 jlong handshake_timeout) {
00215         return functions->Attach(this, address, attach_timeout, handshake_timeout);
00216     }
00217 
00218     jdwpTransportError StartListening(const char* address,
00219                 char** actual_address) {
00220         return functions->StartListening(this, address, actual_address);
00221     }
00222 
00223     jdwpTransportError StopListening(void) {
00224         return functions->StopListening(this);
00225     }
00226 
00227     jdwpTransportError Accept(jlong accept_timeout, jlong handshake_timeout) {
00228         return functions->Accept(this, accept_timeout, handshake_timeout);
00229     }
00230 
00231     jboolean IsOpen(void) {
00232         return functions->IsOpen(this);
00233     }
00234 
00235     jdwpTransportError Close(void) {
00236         return functions->Close(this);
00237     }
00238 
00239     jdwpTransportError ReadPacket(jdwpPacket *pkt) {
00240         return functions->ReadPacket(this, pkt);
00241     }
00242 
00243     jdwpTransportError WritePacket(const jdwpPacket* pkt) {
00244         return functions->WritePacket(this, pkt);
00245     }
00246 
00247     jdwpTransportError GetLastError(char** error) {
00248         return functions->GetLastError(this, error);
00249     }
00250 
00251 
00252 #endif /* __cplusplus */
00253 };
00254 
00255 #ifdef __cplusplus
00256 } /* extern "C" */
00257 #endif /* __cplusplus */

00259 #endif /* JDWPTRANSPORT_H */
